Frequently Asked Questions

What is drugfacts.wiki?

DrugFacts Wiki is a comprehensive platform providing professional drug information based on FDA-approved labeling. We offer detailed prescribing information, patient-friendly explanations, and related content to help healthcare professionals and patients make informed decisions.

Is the information on drugfacts.wiki accurate?

All drug information is sourced directly from FDA-approved drug labels and official prescribing information. However, this information is for educational purposes only and should not replace professional medical advice.

Can I use this site for medical decisions?

No. DrugFacts Wiki provides educational information only. Always consult with your healthcare provider for medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment decisions.

How often is the drug information updated?

We regularly update our database with the latest FDA-approved drug labeling information. However, drug information can change frequently, so always verify with your healthcare provider or the latest FDA labeling.

Is drugfacts.wiki free to use?

Yes, drugfacts.wiki is completely free to use. We believe that access to accurate drug information should be available to everyone.

Do you collect personal information?

We do not collect any personally identifying information. Your privacy and anonymity are completely protected when using our platform.

Can I suggest drugs to be added?

Currently, our database includes FDA-approved medications with official labeling. For suggestions or requests, please contact us through our contact page.

How do I report an error or issue?

If you notice any errors or technical issues, please contact our support team immediately. We take accuracy very seriously and will investigate all reports promptly.

Still have questions?

If you can't find the answer you're looking for, please contact us through our contact page. We're here to help!
